title: NeMig -- A Bilingual News Collection and Knowledge Graph about Migration. (arXiv:2309.00550v1 [cs.IR])
abstract: News recommendation plays a critical role in shaping the public's worldviews through the way in which it filters and disseminates information about different topics. Given the crucial impact that media plays in opinion formation, especially for sensitive topics, understanding the effects of personalized recommendation beyond accuracy has become essential in today's digital society. In this work, we present NeMig, a bilingual news collection on the topic of migration, and corresponding rich user data. In comparison to existing news recommendation datasets, which comprise a large variety of monolingual news, NeMig covers articles on a single controversial topic, published in both Germany and the US. We annotate the sentiment polarization of the articles and the political leanings of the media outlets, in addition to extracting subtopics and named entities disambiguated through Wikidata. translated_title: NeMig -- 一份关于移民的双语新闻收集和知识图谱
translated_abstract: 新闻推荐通过过滤和传播关于不同主题的信息，对塑造公众世界观起着至关重要的作用。在今天的数字社会中，理解个性化推荐的影响已经变得至关重要，尤其是对于敏感话题。在这项工作中，我们介绍了NeMig，一份关于移民主题的双语新闻收集以及相应的丰富用户数据。相对于现有的新闻推荐数据集，NeMig涵盖了德国和美国发布的有关单一有争议话题的文章。我们注释了文章的情绪倾向以及媒体机构的政治倾向，并提取了通过Wikidata消歧义的子主题和命名实体。这些特征可以用来分析算法新闻推荐的影响，超过基于准确度的评估。
tldr: NeMig是一份关于移民的双语新闻收集和知识图谱，对个性化新闻推荐的影响进行了研究，提供了文章的情绪倾向、媒体机构的政治倾向，以及消歧义的子主题和命名实体。
en_tdlr: NeMig is a bilingual news collection and knowledge graph about migration. It investigates the effects of personalized news recommendation and provides information on article sentiment polarization, political leanings of media outlets, and disambiguated subtopics and named entities.
